Process_flow module

Process_flow module

Process_flow module¶

Created on Thu Jun 11 17:33:54 2015

@author: gaetan

Process_flow.Process_flow(path_work, name_desc, path_images, nb_word, sizeDesc, nb_images='ALL', start_img=1)[source]¶

Function called in the main, she do all the chain process. Here you can choose your path directory in function of the differents descriptors you want to compile. You will found the next parameters :

Parameters:
  • path_work (string) – Path where the user wants to create folders for the descriptors.
  • name_desc (string) – Name of descriptor choosen
  • path_images (string) – Path of workspace: pictures should be in this folder.
  • nb_word (int) – Number of words you want in the Bag of Words.
  • sizeDesc (int) – size of the descriptor. For example: the SIFT descriptor has a size = 128
  • nb_images (int) – Number of pictures to process. Default : ALL
  • start_img (int) – Number of the start picture (if you don’t want to process all the images) . Default : 1
Return res:

result of the quantization, one line = the quantization for this images
Return type:

nd.array

:return ID[70:100]: ID of the pictures take in the xml files (if the quantization is perfect res = ID[70:100]) :rtype: nd.array :return: List of the path of the images to process (in the order of process) :rtype: list

To compute the SIFT descriptors you have to put in commentary the next line (103)

mat_kp, desc = CO.C2OPatch(list_path_img[i-1], 4, 6, 3)

To compute the C2O descriptors you have to put in commentary the next line (104)

kp,desc = SIFT(list_path_img[i-1])

For launch the compilation of this function, put this line :

ID_classif, ID_know, img = fc.Process_flow(path_work, descriptor, path_images, nb_word, sizeDesc)
